Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A tragic story of love and ambition set in the Jazz Age.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A powerful tale of racial injustice in the American South.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian future under constant surveillance.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A witty exploration of love and societal expectations in Regency England.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A teenâ€™s candid journey through isolation and disillusionment in postwar America.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A reluctant hobbit embarks on an epic adventure to reclaim a lost treasure.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A symbologist uncovers a religious conspiracy through cryptic clues.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: A young wizard discovers his destiny at a magical school.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A shepherd follows his dreams and seeks treasure in a journey of self-discovery.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Description: A haunting tale of a father and son surviving in a desolate world.

Title: The Midnight Library
Author: Matt Haig
Description: A woman explores parallel lives through a magical library at the edge of existence.

Title: Sapiens
Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: A sweeping history of humankind from evolution to the modern age.

Title: Dune
Author: Frank Herbert
Description: A young noble battles for control of a desert planet rich in a valuable resource.

Title: The Silent Patient
Author: Alex Michaelides
Description: A psychotherapist investigates why a famous artist stopped speaking after a murder.

Title: Where the Crawdads Sing
Author: Delia Owens
Description: A girl raised in the marsh becomes a murder suspect in a small town.

Title: The Book Thief
Author: Markus Zusak
Description: A girl finds comfort in books during the horrors of Nazi Germany.

Title: The Night Circus
Author: Erin Morgenstern
Description: Two magicians duel in a magical circus that appears without warning.

Title: Educated
Author: Tara Westover
Description: A woman escapes her survivalist upbringing to earn a PhD from Cambridge.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: A dystopian world where women are controlled and stripped of rights.

Title: Circe
Author: Madeline Miller
Description: A retelling of the myth of Circe and a powerful witch banished to an island.
